pr_title: DBZ-2604 Use default db charset as default table charset

timeline.bodyText: hi @jpechane May I know why previous parser.currentDatabaseCharset() does not return database encoding?
timeline.author: victorxiang30

replies.bodyText: It reads character_set_database db variable which is set to the database to which Debezium JDBC client is connected, not to table/database DDL which is now parsing and processing.
replies.author: jpechane

replies.bodyText: I see. Does this mean db variable will override table/database DDL which is now parsing? How about the cases when column level is UTF8mb4 but db variable is latin2? In this case, the column will be misintepreted as latin2 but is supposed to be encoded as UTF8mb4
replies.author: victorxiang30

replies.bodyText:
No the logic is

if column has its own charset then use it
if table has default charset then use it
if database to which the table belongs has a charset value then use it
replies.author: jpechane
